meanings.definition: A tempo marking indicating a moderately slow tempo, faster than andante but slower than allegretto.
meanings.sent1: The pianist played the piece at an andantino pace, creating a soothing atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The orchestra performed the symphony at an andantino tempo, keeping the music flowing smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The andantino rhythm of the music made the audience sway gently in their seats.
meanings.sent4: The andantino melody danced through the air, wrapping the listeners in a calm embrace.
meanings.sent5: The andantino tempo painted a picture of a tranquil river flowing steadily under the moonlight.
